snippet: The delegations wrapped up their first official meeting in Pakistan with an agreement to continue discussions about the opening of peace talks.
abstract: Peace talks arranged by Pakistani officials between Afghan government and Taliban end with agreement to meet again, raising hope that end to Taliban revolt in Afghanistan is underway; optimism from Murree meeting gives rare political win to Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani who maintains there could be no peace without help of Pakistan, and was criticized for effort.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan; Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; and Fazal Muzhary and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: The delegations wrapped up their first official meeting in Pakistan with an agreement to continue discussions about the opening of peace talks.

headline.main: Taliban-Afghan Meeting Ends With Optimism and Plans to Hold More Talks
headline.print_headline: Afghan-Taliban Meeting Ends With Optimism and Plans to Hold More Talks
